intro: Atropis bulbosa, commonly known as the bulbous starflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces bulbous structures that store nutrients, aiding in its survival during unfavorable conditions. Its leaves are typically basal and lance-shaped, while its flowers bloom in shades of blue or purple. Atropis bulbosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides.
